JUDGES: Anatoly Kovler;Christos Rozakis;Elisabeth Steiner;George Nicolaou;Giorgio Malinverni;Khanlar Hajiyev
TEXT: The applicant , Mr ORG GPE , is a NORP national who was born in DATE and lives in GPE , GPE . ORG ( “ the Government ” ) were represented by PERSON , former Representative of GPE at ORG .
The facts of the case , as submitted by the parties , may be summarised as follows .

On DATE the applicant was dismissed from work at construction department No . CARDINAL of a joint stock company GPE ( ООО “ NORP ” ) . Contrary to the requirements of the domestic law the applicant 's “ work record card ” – a history of one 's working life used for calculating pensions – was kept by the employer and was not returned to the applicant until DATE .

On DATE the applicant brought proceedings against his former employer seeking to be reinstated . However , since none of the parties appeared for the hearing , on DATE the ORG of the Yamalo - Nenets Autonomous Region left the applicant 's claims unexamined . It appears that the applicant did not attempt to appeal against the above decision .

DATE , on DATE , the applicant brought proceedings against his former employer seeking to have the entry on his work record card as regards the date of his dismissal changed to DATE and to recover salary arrears . On DATE the ORG returned the applicant 's writ , because he had failed to sign it .
On DATE the applicant also brought similar proceedings against his former employer before the ORG .
Eventually , on DATE the ORG refused to examine the applicant 's claims as it had no territorial jurisdiction over the matter . The applicant did not appeal against this decision .

On DATE the applicant returned his writ , duly signed , to ORG . On DATE the ORG asked the applicant to clarify the name and the location of the defendant . Since the applicant did not do so within the prescribed time - limit , on DATE the ORG returned the writ to the applicant .
Eventually , following a new attempt by the applicant , on DATE the ORG refused to accept the applicant 's writ for lack of territorial jurisdiction over the matter .
On DATE the applicant submitted his claims concerning the date of his dismissal and the payment of salary arrears to the ORG .
On DATE the ORG dismissed the applicant 's claims . On DATE the Yamalo - Nenets Autonomous Regional Court quashed the judgment on appeal and remitted the case for fresh examination .

Following the fresh examination of the case , on DATE the ORG granted the applicant 's claims in part , obliged the defendant to change the date of the applicant 's dismissal and to pay certain salary arrears .

On DATE the Yamalo - Nenets Autonomous Regional Court upheld the judgment with regard to changing the date of the applicant 's dismissal , quashed the rest of the judgment and remitted it for fresh examination .
On DATE the hearing of the applicant 's case in the part quashed on appeal by the decision of CARDINAL DATE was fixed for DATE .
During the hearing on DATE the applicant added to his claims , and the defendant brought a counterclaim .
The next hearing was fixed for DATE .
Following the applicant 's request , on DATE the case was assigned to another judge .

On DATE the date of dismissal on the applicant 's work record card was changed in compliance with the judgment of DATE , as upheld on DATE , and the enforcement proceedings in this respect were terminated .
On DATE the ORG of ORG quashed the judgment of DATE and the appeal decision of CARDINAL DATE by way of supervisory review and remitted the matter for fresh examination .
On DATE the ORG set the hearing for DATE .

As regards the CARDINAL hearings scheduled DATE and DATE , they were adjourned either on the applicant 's requests or in view of the necessity to examine his petitions ( i.e. to clarify the decision of CARDINAL DATE , to obtain additional evidence , to examine some of the applicant 's claims in separate proceedings , to suspend the proceedings , to appoint expert examinations , to involve third parties to the proceedings , etc . ) . However , the ORG dismissed those requests and petitions , having concluded that they were aimed at delaying the proceedings .
On DATE the ORG dismissed the applicant 's claims in full .
On DATE the Yamalo - Nenets Autonomous Regional Court upheld the judgment on appeal .

Although the judgment of DATE and the appeal decision of DATE were quashed by way of supervisory review , the date of the applicant 's dismissal as recorded on his work record card in compliance with the above judgments on DATE remained unchanged .

Under LAW of DATE in force until DATE , a case must be prepared for trial DATE after the writ is lodged . If litigants are from the same town or territory , disputes between them relating to labour issues must be examined by a court of first instance within DATE . Otherwise such disputes must be examined within DATE .
Under LAW of DATE , an appeal court must examine an appeal DATE after it is filed .
Under LAW , effective as from DATE , disputes relating to labour issues must be examined within DATE after the writ is lodged .
Under LAW an appeal court must examine an appeal DATE after it is filed .
